00058 /* Find all logs in CONFIG directory and link then into list */
00059 int class_dentry_readdir(const struct lu_env *env,
00060                          struct mgs_device *mgs, struct list_head *log_list)
00061 {
00062         struct dt_object    *dir = mgs->mgs_configs_dir;
00063         const struct dt_it_ops *iops;
00064         struct dt_it        *it;
00065         struct mgs_direntry *de;
00066         char                *key;
00067         int                  rc, key_sz;
00068 
00069         INIT_LIST_HEAD(log_list);
00070 
00071         LASSERT(dir);
00072         LASSERT(dir->do_index_ops);
00073 
00074         iops = &dir->do_index_ops->dio_it;
00075         it = iops->init(env, dir, LUDA_64BITHASH);
00076         if (IS_ERR(it))
00077                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(it));
00078 
00079         rc = iops->load(env, it, 0);
00080         if (rc <= 0)
00081                 GOTO(fini, rc = 0);
00082 
00083         /* main cycle */
00084         do {
00085                 key = (void *)iops->key(env, it);
00086                 if (IS_ERR(key)) {
00087                         CERROR("%s: key failed when listing %s: rc = %d\n",
00088                                mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR,
00089                                (int) PTR_ERR(key));
00090                         goto next;
00091                 }
00092                 key_sz = iops->key_size(env, it);
00093                 LASSERT(key_sz > 0);
00094 
00095                 /* filter out "." and ".." entries */
00096                 if (key[0] == '.') {
00097                         if (key_sz == 1)
00098                                 goto next;
00099                         if (key_sz == 2 && key[1] == '.')
00100                                 goto next;
00101                 }
00102 
00103                 de = mgs_direntry_alloc(key_sz + 1);
00104                 if (de == NULL) {
00105                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00106                         break;
00107                 }
00108 
00109                 memcpy(de->mde_name, key, key_sz);
00110                 de->mde_name[key_sz] = 0;
00111 
00112                 list_add(&de->mde_list, log_list);
00113 
00114 next:
00115                 rc = iops->next(env, it);
00116         } while (rc == 0);
00117         rc = 0;
00118 
00119         iops->put(env, it);
00120 
00121 fini:
00122         iops->fini(env, it);
00123         if (rc)
00124                 CERROR("%s: key failed when listing %s: rc = %d\n",
00125                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR, rc);
00126         RETURN(rc);
00127 }

00131 static inline int name_create(char **newname, char *prefix, char *suffix)
00132 {
00133         LASSERT(newname);
00134         OBD_ALLOC(*newname, strlen(prefix) + strlen(suffix) + 1);
00135         if (!*newname)
00136                 return -ENOMEM;
00137         sprintf(*newname, "%s%s", prefix, suffix);
00138         return 0;
00139 }
00140 
00141 static inline void name_destroy(char **name)
00142 {
00143         if (*name)
00144                 OBD_FREE(*name, strlen(*name) + 1);
00145         *name = NULL;
00146 }
00147 
00148 struct mgs_fsdb_handler_data
00149 {
00150         struct fs_db   *fsdb;
00151         __u32           ver;
00152 };
00153 
00154 /* from the (client) config log, figure out:
00155         1. which ost's/mdt's are configured (by index)
00156         2. what the last config step is
00157         3. COMPAT_18 osc name
00158 */
00159 /* It might be better to have a separate db file, instead of parsing the info
00160    out of the client log.  This is slow and potentially error-prone. */
00161 static int mgs_fsdb_handler(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00162                             struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00163 {
00164         struct mgs_fsdb_handler_data *d = data;
00165         struct fs_db *fsdb = d->fsdb;
00166         int cfg_len = rec->lrh_len;
00167         char *cfg_buf = (char*) (rec + 1);
00168         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00169         __u32 index;
00170         int rc = 0;
00171         ENTRY;
00172 
00173         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
00174                 CERROR("unhandled lrh_type: %#x\n", rec->lrh_type);
00175                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00176         }
00177 
00178         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(cfg_buf, cfg_len);
00179         if (rc) {
00180                 CERROR("Insane cfg\n");
00181                 RETURN(rc);
00182         }
00183 
00184         lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)cfg_buf;
00185 
00186         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "cmd %x %s %s\n", lcfg->lcfg_command,
00187                lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00188 
00189         /* Figure out ost indicies */
00190         /* lov_modify_tgts add 0:lov1  1:ost1_UUID  2(index):0  3(gen):1 */
00191         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD ||
00192             lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_LOV_DEL_OBD) {
00193                 index = simple_strtoul(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2),
00194                                        NULL, 10);
00195                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "OST index for %s is %u (%s)\n",
00196                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1), index,
00197                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
00198                 set_bit(index, fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map);
00199         }
00200 
00201         /* Figure out mdt indicies */
00202         /* attach   0:MDC_uml1_mdsA_MNT_client  1:mdc  2:1d834_MNT_client_03f */
00203         if ((lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH) &&
00204             (strcmp(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1), LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) == 0)) {
00205                 rc = server_name2index(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
00206                                        &index, NULL);
00207                 if (rc != LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT) {
00208                         CWARN("Unparsable MDC name %s, assuming index 0\n",
00209                               lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
00210                         index = 0;
00211                 }
00212                 rc = 0;
00213                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "MDT index is %u\n", index);
00214                 set_bit(index, fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map);
00215                 fsdb->fsdb_mdt_count ++;
00216         }
00217 
00222         if (fsdb->fsdb_gen == 0) {
00223                 CERROR("Old config format is not supported\n");
00224                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00225         }
00226 
00227         /*
00228          * compat to 1.8, check osc name used by MDT0 to OSTs, bz18548.
00229          */
00230         if (!test_bit(FSDB_OSCNAME18, &fsdb->fsdb_flags) &&
00231             lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ATTACH &&
00232             strcmp(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1), LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) == 0) {
00233                 if (OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(d->ver) == 1 &&
00234                     OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(d->ver) <= 8) {
00235                         CWARN("MDT using 1.8 OSC name scheme\n");
00236                         set_bit(FSDB_OSCNAME18, &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00237                 }
00238         }
00239 
00240         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER) {
00241                 struct cfg_marker *marker;
00242                 marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00243 
00244                 d->ver = marker->cm_vers;
00245 
00246                 /* Keep track of the latest marker step */
00247                 fsdb->fsdb_gen = max(fsdb->fsdb_gen, marker->cm_step);
00248         }
00249 
00250         RETURN(rc);
00251 }
00252 
00253 /* fsdb->fsdb_mutex is already held  in mgs_find_or_make_fsdb*/
00254 static int mgs_get_fsdb_from_llog(const struct lu_env *env,
00255                                   struct mgs_device *mgs,
00256                                   struct fs_db *fsdb)
00257 {
00258         char                            *logname;
00259         struct llog_handle              *loghandle;
00260         struct llog_ctxt                *ctxt;
00261         struct mgs_fsdb_handler_data     d = { fsdb, 0 };
00262         int rc;
00263 
00264         ENTRY;
00265 
00266         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
00267         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
00268         rc = name_create(&logname, fsdb->fsdb_name, "-client");
00269         if (rc)
00270                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00271         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &loghandle, NULL, logname);
00272         if (rc)
00273                 GOTO(out_pop, rc);
00274 
00275         rc = llog_init_handle(env, loghandle, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
00276         if (rc)
00277                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00278 
00279         if (llog_get_size(loghandle) <= 1)
00280                 set_bit(FSDB_LOG_EMPTY, &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00281 
00282         rc = llog_process(env, loghandle, mgs_fsdb_handler, (void *)&d, NULL);
00283         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "get_db = %d\n", rc);
00284 out_close:
00285         llog_close(env, loghandle);
00286 out_pop:
00287         name_destroy(&logname);
00288 out_put:
00289         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00290 
00291         RETURN(rc);
00292 }
00293 
00294 static void mgs_free_fsdb_srpc(struct fs_db *fsdb)
00295 {
00296         struct mgs_tgt_srpc_conf *tgtconf;
00297 
00298         /* free target-specific rules */
00299         while (fsdb->fsdb_srpc_tgt) {
00300                 tgtconf = fsdb->fsdb_srpc_tgt;
00301                 fsdb->fsdb_srpc_tgt = tgtconf->mtsc_next;
00302 
00303                 LASSERT(tgtconf->mtsc_tgt);
00304 
00305                 sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&tgtconf->mtsc_rset);
00306                 OBD_FREE(tgtconf->mtsc_tgt, strlen(tgtconf->mtsc_tgt) + 1);
00307                 OBD_FREE_PTR(tgtconf);
00308         }
00309 
00310         /* free general rules */
00311         sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&fsdb->fsdb_srpc_gen);
00312 }
00313 
00314 struct fs_db *mgs_find_fsdb(struct mgs_device *mgs, char *fsname)
00315 {
00316         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00317         struct list_head *tmp;
00318 
00319         list_for_each(tmp, &mgs->mgs_fs_db_list) {
00320                 fsdb = list_entry(tmp, struct fs_db, fsdb_list);
00321                 if (strcmp(fsdb->fsdb_name, fsname) == 0)
00322                         return fsdb;
00323         }
00324         return NULL;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /* caller must hold the mgs->mgs_fs_db_lock */
00328 static struct fs_db *mgs_new_fsdb(const struct lu_env *env,
00329                                   struct mgs_device *mgs, char *fsname)
00330 {
00331         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00332         int rc;
00333         ENTRY;
00334 
00335         if (strlen(fsname) >= sizeof(fsdb->fsdb_name)) {
00336                 CERROR("fsname %s is too long\n", fsname);
00337                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
00338         }
00339 
00340         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(fsdb);
00341         if (!fsdb)
00342                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00343 
00344         strcpy(fsdb->fsdb_name, fsname);
00345         mutex_init(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00346         set_bit(FSDB_UDESC, &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00347         fsdb->fsdb_gen = 1;
00348 
00349         if (strcmp(fsname, MGSSELF_NAME) == 0) {
00350                 set_bit(FSDB_MGS_SELF, &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00351                 fsdb->fsdb_mgs = mgs;
00352         } else {
00353                 OBD_ALLOC(fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00354                 OBD_ALLOC(fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00355                 if (!fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map || !fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map) {
00356                         CERROR("No memory for index maps\n");
00357                         GOTO(err, rc = -ENOMEM);
00358                 }
00359 
00360                 rc = name_create(&fsdb->fsdb_clilov, fsname, "-clilov");
00361                 if (rc)
00362                         GOTO(err, rc);
00363                 rc = name_create(&fsdb->fsdb_clilmv, fsname, "-clilmv");
00364                 if (rc)
00365                         GOTO(err, rc);
00366 
00367                 /* initialise data for NID table */
00368                 mgs_ir_init_fs(env, mgs, fsdb);
00369 
00370                 lproc_mgs_add_live(mgs, fsdb);
00371         }
00372 
00373         list_add(&fsdb->fsdb_list, &mgs->mgs_fs_db_list);
00374 
00375         RETURN(fsdb);
00376 err:
00377         if (fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map)
00378                 OBD_FREE(fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00379         if (fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map)
00380                 OBD_FREE(fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00381         name_destroy(&fsdb->fsdb_clilov);
00382         name_destroy(&fsdb->fsdb_clilmv);
00383         OBD_FREE_PTR(fsdb);
00384         RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00385 }
00386 
00387 static void mgs_free_fsdb(struct mgs_device *mgs, struct fs_db *fsdb)
00388 {
00389         /* wait for anyone with the sem */
00390         mutex_lock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00391         lproc_mgs_del_live(mgs, fsdb);
00392         list_del(&fsdb->fsdb_list);
00393 
00394         /* deinitialize fsr */
00395         mgs_ir_fini_fs(mgs, fsdb);
00396 
00397         if (fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map)
00398                 OBD_FREE(fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00399         if (fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map)
00400                 OBD_FREE(fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00401         name_destroy(&fsdb->fsdb_clilov);
00402         name_destroy(&fsdb->fsdb_clilmv);
00403         mgs_free_fsdb_srpc(fsdb);
00404         mutex_unlock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00405         OBD_FREE_PTR(fsdb);
00406 }
00407 
00408 int mgs_init_fsdb_list(struct mgs_device *mgs)
00409 {
00410         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&mgs->mgs_fs_db_list);
00411         return 0;
00412 }
00413 
00414 int mgs_cleanup_fsdb_list(struct mgs_device *mgs)
00415 {
00416         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00417         struct list_head *tmp, *tmp2;
00418 
00419         mutex_lock(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
00420         list_for_each_safe(tmp, tmp2, &mgs->mgs_fs_db_list) {
00421                 fsdb = list_entry(tmp, struct fs_db, fsdb_list);
00422                 mgs_free_fsdb(mgs, fsdb);
00423         }
00424         mutex_unlock(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
00425         return 0;
00426 }
00427 
00428 int mgs_find_or_make_fsdb(const struct lu_env *env,
00429                           struct mgs_device *mgs, char *name,
00430                           struct fs_db **dbh)
00431 {
00432         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00433         int rc = 0;
00434 
00435         ENTRY;
00436         mutex_lock(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
00437         fsdb = mgs_find_fsdb(mgs, name);
00438         if (fsdb) {
00439                 mutex_unlock(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
00440                 *dbh = fsdb;
00441                 RETURN(0);
00442         }
00443 
00444         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Creating new db\n");
00445         fsdb = mgs_new_fsdb(env, mgs, name);
00446         /* lock fsdb_mutex until the db is loaded from llogs */
00447         if (!IS_ERR(fsdb))
00448                 mutex_lock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00449         mutex_unlock(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
00450         if (IS_ERR(fsdb))
00451                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(fsdb));
00452 
00453         if (!test_bit(FSDB_MGS_SELF, &fsdb->fsdb_flags)) {
00454                 /* populate the db from the client llog */
00455                 rc = mgs_get_fsdb_from_llog(env, mgs, fsdb);
00456                 if (rc) {
00457                         CERROR("Can't get db from client log %d\n", rc);
00458                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
00459                 }
00460         }
00461 
00462         /* populate srpc rules from params llog */
00463         rc = mgs_get_fsdb_srpc_from_llog(env, mgs, fsdb);
00464         if (rc) {
00465                 CERROR("Can't get db from params log %d\n", rc);
00466                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
00467         }
00468 
00469         mutex_unlock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00470         *dbh = fsdb;
00471 
00472         RETURN(0);
00473 
00474 out_free:
00475         mutex_unlock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00476         mgs_free_fsdb(mgs, fsdb);
00477         return rc;
00478 }
00479 
00480 /* 1 = index in use
00481    0 = index unused
00482    -1= empty client log */
00483 int mgs_check_index(const struct lu_env *env,
00484                     struct mgs_device *mgs,
00485                     struct mgs_target_info *mti)
00486 {
00487         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00488         void *imap;
00489         int rc = 0;
00490         ENTRY;
00491 
00492         LASSERT(!(mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_NEED_INDEX));
00493 
00494         rc = mgs_find_or_make_fsdb(env, mgs, mti->mti_fsname, &fsdb);
00495         if (rc) {
00496                 CERROR("Can't get db for %s\n", mti->mti_fsname);
00497                 RETURN(rc);
00498         }
00499 
00500         if (test_bit(FSDB_LOG_EMPTY, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
00501                 RETURN(-1);
00502 
00503         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00504                 imap = fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map;
00505         else if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT)
00506                 imap = fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map;
00507         else
00508                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00509 
00510         if (test_bit(mti->mti_stripe_index, imap))
00511                 RETURN(1);
00512         RETURN(0);
00513 }
00514 
00515 static __inline__ int next_index(void *index_map, int map_len)
00516 {
00517         int i;
00518         for (i = 0; i < map_len * 8; i++)
00519                 if (!test_bit(i, index_map)) {
00520                          return i;
00521                  }
00522         CERROR("max index %d exceeded.\n", i);
00523         return -1;
00524 }
00525 
00526 /* Return codes:
00527         0  newly marked as in use
00528         <0 err
00529         +EALREADY for update of an old index */
00530 static int mgs_set_index(const struct lu_env *env,
00531                          struct mgs_device *mgs,
00532                          struct mgs_target_info *mti)
00533 {
00534         struct fs_db *fsdb;
00535         void *imap;
00536         int rc = 0;
00537         ENTRY;
00538 
00539         rc = mgs_find_or_make_fsdb(env, mgs, mti->mti_fsname, &fsdb);
00540         if (rc) {
00541                 CERROR("Can't get db for %s\n", mti->mti_fsname);
00542                 RETURN(rc);
00543         }
00544 
00545         mutex_lock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00546         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST) {
00547                 imap = fsdb->fsdb_ost_index_map;
00548         } else if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT) {
00549                 imap = fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map;
00550         } else {
00551                 GOTO(out_up, rc = -EINVAL);
00552         }
00553 
00554         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_NEED_INDEX) {
00555                 rc = next_index(imap, INDEX_MAP_SIZE);
00556                 if (rc == -1)
00557                         GOTO(out_up, rc = -ERANGE);
00558                 mti->mti_stripe_index = rc;
00559                 if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT)
00560                         fsdb->fsdb_mdt_count ++;
00561         }
00562 
00563         /* the last index(0xffff) is reserved for default value. */
00564         if (mti->mti_stripe_index >= INDEX_MAP_SIZE * 8 - 1) {
00565                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x13f, "Server %s requested index %u, "
00566                                    "but index must be less than %u.\n",
00567                                    mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_stripe_index,
00568                                    INDEX_MAP_SIZE * 8 - 1);
00569                 GOTO(out_up, rc = -ERANGE);
00570         }
00571 
00572         if (test_bit(mti->mti_stripe_index, imap)) {
00573                 if ((mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_VIRGIN) &&
00574                     !(mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_WRITECONF)) {
00575                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x140, "Server %s requested index "
00576                                            "%d, but that index is already in "
00577                                            "use. Use --writeconf to force\n",
00578                                            mti->mti_svname,
00579                                            mti->mti_stripe_index);
00580                         GOTO(out_up, rc = -EADDRINUSE);
00581                 } else {
00582                         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Server %s updating index %d\n",
00583                                mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_stripe_index);
00584                         GOTO(out_up, rc = EALREADY);
00585                 }
00586         }
00587 
00588         set_bit(mti->mti_stripe_index, imap);
00589         clear_bit(FSDB_LOG_EMPTY, &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00590         mutex_unlock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00591         server_make_name(mti->mti_flags & ~(LDD_F_VIRGIN | LDD_F_WRITECONF),
00592                          mti->mti_stripe_index, mti->mti_fsname, mti->mti_svname);
00593 
00594         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Set index for %s to %d\n", mti->mti_svname,
00595                mti->mti_stripe_index);
00596 
00597         RETURN(0);
00598 out_up:
00599         mutex_unlock(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex);
00600         return rc;
00601 }
00602 
00603 struct mgs_modify_lookup {
00604         struct cfg_marker mml_marker;
00605         int               mml_modified;
00606 };
00607 
00608 static int mgs_modify_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
00609                               struct llog_handle *llh,
00610                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00611 {
00612         struct mgs_modify_lookup *mml = data;
00613         struct cfg_marker *marker;
00614         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = REC_DATA(rec);
00615         int cfg_len = REC_DATA_LEN(rec);
00616         int rc;
00617         ENTRY;
00618 
00619         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
00620                 CERROR("unhandled lrh_type: %#x\n", rec->lrh_type);
00621                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00622         }
00623 
00624         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, cfg_len);
00625         if (rc) {
00626                 CERROR("Insane cfg\n");
00627                 RETURN(rc);
00628         }
00629 
00630         /* We only care about markers */
00631         if (lcfg->lcfg_command != LCFG_MARKER)
00632                 RETURN(0);
00633 
00634         marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00635         if ((strcmp(mml->mml_marker.cm_comment, marker->cm_comment) == 0) &&
00636             (strcmp(mml->mml_marker.cm_tgtname, marker->cm_tgtname) == 0) &&
00637             !(marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP)) {
00638                 /* Found a non-skipped marker match */
00639                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Changing rec %u marker %d %x->%x: %s %s\n",
00640                        rec->lrh_index, marker->cm_step,
00641                        marker->cm_flags, mml->mml_marker.cm_flags,
00642                        marker->cm_tgtname, marker->cm_comment);
00643                 /* Overwrite the old marker llog entry */
00644                 marker->cm_flags &= ~CM_EXCLUDE; /* in case we're unexcluding */
00645                 marker->cm_flags |= mml->mml_marker.cm_flags;
00646                 marker->cm_canceltime = mml->mml_marker.cm_canceltime;
00647                 rc = llog_write(env, llh, rec, rec->lrh_index);
00648                 if (!rc)
00649                          mml->mml_modified++;
00650         }
00651 
00652         RETURN(rc);
00653 }
00654 
00662 static int mgs_modify(const struct lu_env *env, struct mgs_device *mgs,
00663                       struct fs_db *fsdb, struct mgs_target_info *mti,
00664                       char *logname, char *devname, char *comment, int flags)
00665 {
00666         struct llog_handle *loghandle;
00667         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
00668         struct mgs_modify_lookup *mml;
00669         int rc;
00670 
00671         ENTRY;
00672 
00673         LASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&fsdb->fsdb_mutex));
00674         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "modify %s/%s/%s fl=%x\n", logname, devname, comment,
00675                flags);
00676 
00677         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
00678         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
00679         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &loghandle, NULL, logname, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
00680         if (rc < 0) {
00681                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
00682                         rc = 0;
00683                 GOTO(out_pop, rc);
00684         }
00685 
00686         rc = llog_init_handle(env, loghandle, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
00687         if (rc)
00688                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00689 
00690         if (llog_get_size(loghandle) <= 1)
00691                 GOTO(out_close, rc = 0);
00692 
00693         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mml);
00694         if (!mml)
00695                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -ENOMEM);
00696         if (strlcpy(mml->mml_marker.cm_comment, comment,
00697                     sizeof(mml->mml_marker.cm_comment)) >=
00698             sizeof(mml->mml_marker.cm_comment))
00699                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -E2BIG);
00700         if (strlcpy(mml->mml_marker.cm_tgtname, devname,
00701                     sizeof(mml->mml_marker.cm_tgtname)) >=
00702             sizeof(mml->mml_marker.cm_tgtname))
00703                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -E2BIG);
00704         /* Modify mostly means cancel */
00705         mml->mml_marker.cm_flags = flags;
00706         mml->mml_marker.cm_canceltime = flags ? cfs_time_current_sec() : 0;
00707         mml->mml_modified = 0;
00708         rc = llog_process(env, loghandle, mgs_modify_handler, (void *)mml,
00709                           NULL);
00710         if (!rc && !mml->mml_modified)
00711                 rc = 1;
00712 
00713 out_free:
00714         OBD_FREE_PTR(mml);
00715 
00716 out_close:
00717         llog_close(env, loghandle);
00718 out_pop:
00719         if (rc < 0)
00720                 CERROR("%s: modify %s/%s failed: rc = %d\n",
00721                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, mti->mti_svname, comment, rc);
00722         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00723         RETURN(rc);
00724 }
00725 
00727 struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup {
00728         /* Nids are replaced for this target device */
00729         struct mgs_target_info target;
00730         /* Temporary modified llog */
00731         struct llog_handle *temp_llh;
00732         /* Flag is set if in target block*/
00733         int in_target_device;
00734         /* Nids already added. Just skip (multiple nids) */
00735         int device_nids_added;
00736         /* Flag is set if this block should not be copied */
00737         int skip_it;
00738 };
00739 
00750 static int check_markers(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg,
00751                          struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup *mrul)
00752 {
00753          struct cfg_marker *marker;
00754 
00755         /* Track markers. Find given device */
00756         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER) {
00757                 marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00758                 /* Clean llog from records marked as CM_EXCLUDE.
00759                    CM_SKIP records are used for "active" command
00760                    and can be restored if needed */
00761                 if ((marker->cm_flags & (CM_EXCLUDE | CM_START)) ==
00762                     (CM_EXCLUDE | CM_START)) {
00763                         mrul->skip_it = 1;
00764                         return 1;
00765                 }
00766 
00767                 if ((marker->cm_flags & (CM_EXCLUDE | CM_END)) ==
00768                     (CM_EXCLUDE | CM_END)) {
00769                         mrul->skip_it = 0;
00770                         return 1;
00771                 }
00772 
00773                 if (strcmp(mrul->target.mti_svname, marker->cm_tgtname) == 0) {
00774                         LASSERT(!(marker->cm_flags & CM_START) ||
00775                                 !(marker->cm_flags & CM_END));
00776                         if (marker->cm_flags & CM_START) {
00777                                 mrul->in_target_device = 1;
00778                                 mrul->device_nids_added = 0;
00779                         } else if (marker->cm_flags & CM_END)
00780                                 mrul->in_target_device = 0;
00781                 }
00782         }
00783 
00784         return 0;
00785 }
00786 
00787 static int record_base(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00788                      char *cfgname, lnet_nid_t nid, int cmd,
00789                      char *s1, char *s2, char *s3, char *s4)
00790 {
00791         struct mgs_thread_info  *mgi = mgs_env_info(env);
00792         struct llog_cfg_rec     *lcr;
00793         int rc;
00794 
00795         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "lcfg %s %#x %s %s %s %s\n", cfgname,
00796                cmd, s1, s2, s3, s4);
00797 
00798         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&mgi->mgi_bufs, cfgname);
00799         if (s1)
00800                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 1, s1);
00801         if (s2)
00802                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 2, s2);
00803         if (s3)
00804                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 3, s3);
00805         if (s4)
00806                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 4, s4);
00807 
00808         lcr = lustre_cfg_rec_new(cmd, &mgi->mgi_bufs);
00809         if (lcr == NULL)
00810                 return -ENOMEM;
00811 
00812         lcr->lcr_cfg.lcfg_nid = nid;
00813         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00814 
00815         lustre_cfg_rec_free(lcr);
00816 
00817         if (rc < 0)
00818                 CDEBUG(D_MGS,
00819                        "failed to write lcfg %s %#x %s %s %s %s: rc = %d\n",
00820                        cfgname, cmd, s1, s2, s3, s4, rc);
00821         return rc;
00822 }
00823 
00824 static inline int record_add_uuid(const struct lu_env *env,
00825                                   struct llog_handle *llh,
00826                                   uint64_t nid, char *uuid)
00827 {
00828         return record_base(env, llh, NULL, nid, LCFG_ADD_UUID, uuid,
00829                            NULL, NULL, NULL);
00830 }
00831 
00832 static inline int record_add_conn(const struct lu_env *env,
00833                                   struct llog_handle *llh,
00834                                   char *devname, char *uuid)
00835 {
00836         return record_base(env, llh, devname, 0, LCFG_ADD_CONN, uuid,
00837                            NULL, NULL, NULL);
00838 }
00839 
00840 static inline int record_attach(const struct lu_env *env,
00841                                 struct llog_handle *llh, char *devname,
00842                                 char *type, char *uuid)
00843 {
00844         return record_base(env, llh, devname, 0, LCFG_ATTACH, type, uuid,
00845                            NULL, NULL);
00846 }
00847 
00848 static inline int record_setup(const struct lu_env *env,
00849                                struct llog_handle *llh, char *devname,
00850                                char *s1, char *s2, char *s3, char *s4)
00851 {
00852         return record_base(env, llh, devname, 0, LCFG_SETUP, s1, s2, s3, s4);
00853 }
00854 
00860 static int process_command(const struct lu_env *env, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg,
00861                            struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup *mrul)
00862 {
00863         int nids_added = 0;
00864         lnet_nid_t nid;
00865         char *ptr;
00866         int rc;
00867 
00868         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ADD_UUID) {
00869                 /* LCFG_ADD_UUID command found. Let's skip original command
00870                    and add passed nids */
00871                 ptr = mrul->target.mti_params;
00872                 while (class_parse_nid(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
00873                         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "add nid %s with uuid %s, "
00874                                "device %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid),
00875                                 mrul->target.mti_params,
00876                                 mrul->target.mti_svname);
00877                         rc = record_add_uuid(env,
00878                                              mrul->temp_llh, nid,
00879                                              mrul->target.mti_params);
00880                         if (!rc)
00881                                 nids_added++;
00882                 }
00883 
00884                 if (nids_added == 0) {
00885                         CERROR("No new nids were added, nid %s with uuid %s, "
00886                                "device %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid),
00887                                mrul->target.mti_params,
00888                                mrul->target.mti_svname);
00889                         RETURN(-ENXIO);
00890                 } else {
00891                         mrul->device_nids_added = 1;
00892                 }
00893 
00894                 return nids_added;
00895         }
00896 
00897         if (mrul->device_nids_added && lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_SETUP) {
00898                 /* LCFG_SETUP command found. UUID should be changed */
00899                 rc = record_setup(env,
00900                                   mrul->temp_llh,
00901                                   /* devname the same */
00902                                   lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
00903                                   /* s1 is not changed */
00904                                   lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
00905                                   /* new uuid should be
00906                                   the full nidlist */
00907                                   mrul->target.mti_params,
00908                                   /* s3 is not changed */
00909                                   lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3),
00910                                   /* s4 is not changed */
00911                                   lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 4));
00912                 return rc ? rc : 1;
00913         }
00914 
00915         /* Another commands in target device block */
00916         return 0;
00917 }
00918 
00929 static int mgs_replace_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
00930                                struct llog_handle *llh,
00931                                struct llog_rec_hdr *rec,
00932                                void *data)
00933 {
00934         struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup *mrul;
00935         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = REC_DATA(rec);
00936         int cfg_len = REC_DATA_LEN(rec);
00937         int rc;
00938         ENTRY;
00939 
00940         mrul = (struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup *)data;
00941 
00942         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
00943                 CERROR("unhandled lrh_type: %#x, cmd %x %s %s\n",
00944                        rec->lrh_type, lcfg->lcfg_command,
00945                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
00946                        lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00947                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00948         }
00949 
00950         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, cfg_len);
00951         if (rc) {
00952                 /* Do not copy any invalidated records */
00953                 GOTO(skip_out, rc = 0);
00954         }
00955 
00956         rc = check_markers(lcfg, mrul);
00957         if (rc || mrul->skip_it)
00958                 GOTO(skip_out, rc = 0);
00959 
00960         /* Write to new log all commands outside target device block */
00961         if (!mrul->in_target_device)
00962                 GOTO(copy_out, rc = 0);
00963 
00964         /* Skip all other LCFG_ADD_UUID and LCFG_ADD_CONN records
00965            (failover nids) for this target, assuming that if then
00966            primary is changing then so is the failover */
00967         if (mrul->device_nids_added &&
00968             (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ADD_UUID ||
00969              lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ADD_CONN))
00970                 GOTO(skip_out, rc = 0);
00971 
00972         rc = process_command(env, lcfg, mrul);
00973         if (rc < 0)
00974                 RETURN(rc);
00975 
00976         if (rc)
00977                 RETURN(0);
00978 copy_out:
00979         /* Record is placed in temporary llog as is */
00980         rc = llog_write(env, mrul->temp_llh, rec, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
00981 
00982         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Copied idx=%d, rc=%d, len=%d, cmd %x %s %s\n",
00983                rec->lrh_index, rc, rec->lrh_len, lcfg->lcfg_command,
00984                lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00985         RETURN(rc);
00986 
00987 skip_out:
00988         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Skipped idx=%d, rc=%d, len=%d, cmd %x %s %s\n",
00989                rec->lrh_index, rc, rec->lrh_len, lcfg->lcfg_command,
00990                lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00991         RETURN(rc);
00992 }
00993 
00994 static int mgs_log_is_empty(const struct lu_env *env,
00995                             struct mgs_device *mgs, char *name)
00996 {
00997         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00998         int                      rc;
00999 
01000         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01001         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
01002 
01003         rc = llog_is_empty(env, ctxt, name);
01004         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01005         return rc;
01006 }
01007 
01008 static int mgs_replace_nids_log(const struct lu_env *env,
01009                                 struct obd_device *mgs, struct fs_db *fsdb,
01010                                 char *logname, char *devname, char *nids)
01011 {
01012         struct llog_handle *orig_llh, *backup_llh;
01013         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
01014         struct mgs_replace_uuid_lookup *mrul;
01015         struct mgs_device *mgs_dev = lu2mgs_dev(mgs->obd_lu_dev);
01016         static struct obd_uuid   cfg_uuid = { .uuid = "config_uuid" };
01017         char *backup;
01018         int rc, rc2;
01019         ENTRY;
01020 
01021         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Replace nids for %s in %s\n", devname, logname);
01022 
01023         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01024         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
01025 
01026         if (mgs_log_is_empty(env, mgs_dev, logname)) {
01027                 /* Log is empty. Nothing to replace */
01028                 GOTO(out_put, rc = 0);
01029         }
01030 
01031         OBD_ALLOC(backup, strlen(logname) + strlen(".bak") + 1);
01032         if (backup == NULL)
01033                 GOTO(out_put, rc = -ENOMEM);
01034 
01035         sprintf(backup, "%s.bak", logname);
01036 
01037         rc = llog_backup(env, mgs, ctxt, ctxt, logname, backup);
01038         if (rc == 0) {
01039                 /* Now erase original log file. Connections are not allowed.
01040                    Backup is already saved */
01041                 rc = llog_erase(env, ctxt, NULL, logname);
01042                 if (rc < 0)
01043                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
01044         } else if (rc != -ENOENT) {
01045                 CERROR("%s: can't make backup for %s: rc = %d\n",
01046                        mgs->obd_name, logname, rc);
01047                 GOTO(out_free,rc);
01048         }
01049 
01050         /* open local log */
01051         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &orig_llh, NULL, logname);
01052         if (rc)
01053                 GOTO(out_restore, rc);
01054 
01055         rc = llog_init_handle(env, orig_llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &cfg_uuid);
01056         if (rc)
01057                 GOTO(out_closel, rc);
01058 
01059         /* open backup llog */
01060         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &backup_llh, NULL, backup,
01061                        LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01062         if (rc)
01063                 GOTO(out_closel, rc);
01064 
01065         rc = llog_init_handle(env, backup_llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01066         if (rc)
01067                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01068 
01069         if (llog_get_size(backup_llh) <= 1)
01070                 GOTO(out_close, rc = 0);
01071 
01072         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mrul);
01073         if (!mrul)
01074                 GOTO(out_close, rc = -ENOMEM);
01075         /* devname is only needed information to replace UUID records */
01076         strlcpy(mrul->target.mti_svname, devname,
01077                 sizeof(mrul->target.mti_svname));
01078         /* parse nids later */
01079         strlcpy(mrul->target.mti_params, nids, sizeof(mrul->target.mti_params));
01080         /* Copy records to this temporary llog */
01081         mrul->temp_llh = orig_llh;
01082 
01083         rc = llog_process(env, backup_llh, mgs_replace_handler,
01084                           (void *)mrul, NULL);
01085         OBD_FREE_PTR(mrul);
01086 out_close:
01087         rc2 = llog_close(NULL, backup_llh);
01088         if (!rc)
01089                 rc = rc2;
01090 out_closel:
01091         rc2 = llog_close(NULL, orig_llh);
01092         if (!rc)
01093                 rc = rc2;
01094 
01095 out_restore:
01096         if (rc) {
01097                 CERROR("%s: llog should be restored: rc = %d\n",
01098                        mgs->obd_name, rc);
01099                 rc2 = llog_backup(env, mgs, ctxt, ctxt, backup,
01100                                   logname);
01101                 if (rc2 < 0)
01102                         CERROR("%s: can't restore backup %s: rc = %d\n",
01103                                mgs->obd_name, logname, rc2);
01104         }
01105 
01106 out_free:
01107         OBD_FREE(backup, strlen(backup) + 1);
01108 
01109 out_put:
01110         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01111 
01112         if (rc)
01113                 CERROR("%s: failed to replace nids in log %s: rc = %d\n",
01114                        mgs->obd_name, logname, rc);
01115 
01116         RETURN(rc);
01117 }
01118 
01128 static int mgs_parse_devname(char *devname, char *fsname, __u32 *index)
01129 {
01130         int rc;
01131         ENTRY;
01132 
01133         /* Extract fsname */
01134         if (fsname) {
01135                 rc = server_name2fsname(devname, fsname, NULL);
01136                 if (rc < 0) {
01137                         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Device name %s without fsname\n",
01138                                devname);
01139                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01140                 }
01141         }
01142 
01143         if (index) {
01144                 rc = server_name2index(devname, index, NULL);
01145                 if (rc < 0) {
01146                         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Device name %s with wrong index\n",
01147                                devname);
01148                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01149                 }
01150         }
01151 
01152         RETURN(0);
01153 }
01154 
01155 /* This is only called during replace_nids */
01156 static int only_mgs_is_running(struct obd_device *mgs_obd)
01157 {
01158         /* TDB: Is global variable with devices count exists? */
01159         int num_devices = get_devices_count();
01160         int num_exports = 0;
01161         struct obd_export *exp;
01162 
01163         spin_lock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01164         list_for_each_entry(exp, &mgs_obd->obd_exports, exp_obd_chain) {
01165                 /* skip self export */
01166                 if (exp == mgs_obd->obd_self_export)
01167                         continue;
01168                 if (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS)
01169                         continue;
01170 
01171                 ++num_exports;
01172 
01173                 CERROR("%s: node %s still connected during replace_nids "
01174                        "connect_flags:%llx\n",
01175                        mgs_obd->obd_name,
01176                        libcfs_nid2str(exp->exp_nid_stats->nid),
01177                        exp_connect_flags(exp));
01178 
01179         }
01180         spin_unlock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01181 
01182         /* osd, MGS and MGC + self_export
01183            (wc -l /proc/fs/lustre/devices <= 2) && (non self exports == 0) */
01184         return (num_devices <= 3) && (num_exports == 0);
01185 }
01186 
01187 static int name_create_mdt(char **logname, char *fsname, int i)
01188 {
01189         char mdt_index[9];
01190 
01191         sprintf(mdt_index, "-MDT%04x", i);
01192         return name_create(logname, fsname, mdt_index);
01193 }
01194 
01205 int mgs_replace_nids(const struct lu_env *env,
01206                      struct mgs_device *mgs,
01207                      char *devname, char *nids)
01208 {
01209         /* Assume fsname is part of device name */
01210         char fsname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
01211         int rc;
01212         __u32 index;
01213         char *logname;
01214         struct fs_db *fsdb;
01215         unsigned int i;
01216         int conn_state;
01217         struct obd_device *mgs_obd = mgs->mgs_obd;
01218         ENTRY;
01219 
01220         /* We can only change NIDs if no other nodes are connected */
01221         spin_lock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01222         conn_state = mgs_obd->obd_no_conn;
01223         mgs_obd->obd_no_conn = 1;
01224         spin_unlock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01225 
01226         /* We can not change nids if not only MGS is started */
01227         if (!only_mgs_is_running(mgs_obd)) {
01228                 CERROR("Only MGS is allowed to be started\n");
01229                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINPROGRESS);
01230         }
01231 
01232         /* Get fsname and index*/
01233         rc = mgs_parse_devname(devname, fsname, &index);
01234         if (rc)
01235                 GOTO(out, rc);
01236 
01237         rc = mgs_find_or_make_fsdb(env, mgs, fsname, &fsdb);
01238         if (rc) {
01239                 CERROR("%s: can't find fsdb: rc = %d\n", fsname, rc);
01240                 GOTO(out, rc);
01241         }
01242 
01243         /* Process client llogs */
01244         name_create(&logname, fsname, "-client");
01245         rc = mgs_replace_nids_log(env, mgs_obd, fsdb, logname, devname, nids);
01246         name_destroy(&logname);
01247         if (rc) {
01248                 CERROR("%s: error while replacing NIDs for %s: rc = %d\n",
01249                        fsname, devname, rc);
01250                 GOTO(out, rc);
01251         }
01252 
01253         /* Process MDT llogs */
01254         for (i = 0; i < INDEX_MAP_SIZE * 8; i++) {
01255                 if (!test_bit(i, fsdb->fsdb_mdt_index_map))
01256                         continue;
01257                 name_create_mdt(&logname, fsname, i);
01258                 rc = mgs_replace_nids_log(env, mgs_obd, fsdb, logname, devname, nids);
01259                 name_destroy(&logname);
01260                 if (rc)
01261                         GOTO(out, rc);
01262         }
01263 
01264 out:
01265         spin_lock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01266         mgs_obd->obd_no_conn = conn_state;
01267         spin_unlock(&mgs_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01268 
01269         RETURN(rc);
01270 }
01271 
01272 static int record_lov_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
01273                             char *devname, struct lov_desc *desc)
01274 {
01275         struct mgs_thread_info  *mgi = mgs_env_info(env);
01276         struct llog_cfg_rec     *lcr;
01277         int rc;
01278 
01279         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&mgi->mgi_bufs, devname);
01280         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 1, desc, sizeof(*desc));
01281         lcr = lustre_cfg_rec_new(LCFG_SETUP, &mgi->mgi_bufs);
01282         if (lcr == NULL)
01283                 return -ENOMEM;
01284 
01285         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01286         lustre_cfg_rec_free(lcr);
01287         return rc;
01288 }
01289 
01290 static int record_lmv_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
01291                             char *devname, struct lmv_desc *desc)
01292 {
01293         struct mgs_thread_info  *mgi = mgs_env_info(env);
01294         struct llog_cfg_rec     *lcr;
01295         int rc;
01296 
01297         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&mgi->mgi_bufs, devname);
01298         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 1, desc, sizeof(*desc));
01299         lcr = lustre_cfg_rec_new(LCFG_SETUP, &mgi->mgi_bufs);
01300         if (lcr == NULL)
01301                 return -ENOMEM;
01302 
01303         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01304         lustre_cfg_rec_free(lcr);
01305         return rc;
01306 }

01335 
01336 static int record_marker(const struct lu_env *env,
01337                          struct llog_handle *llh,
01338                          struct fs_db *fsdb, __u32 flags,
01339                          char *tgtname, char *comment)
01340 {
01341         struct mgs_thread_info *mgi = mgs_env_info(env);
01342         struct llog_cfg_rec *lcr;
01343         int rc;
01344         int cplen = 0;
01345 
01346         if (flags & CM_START)
01347                 fsdb->fsdb_gen++;
01348         mgi->mgi_marker.cm_step = fsdb->fsdb_gen;
01349         mgi->mgi_marker.cm_flags = flags;
01350         mgi->mgi_marker.cm_vers = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01351         cplen = strlcpy(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_tgtname, tgtname,
01352                         sizeof(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_tgtname));
01353         if (cplen >= sizeof(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_tgtname))
01354                 return -E2BIG;
01355         cplen = strlcpy(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_comment, comment,
01356                         sizeof(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_comment));
01357         if (cplen >= sizeof(mgi->mgi_marker.cm_comment))
01358                 return -E2BIG;
01359         mgi->mgi_marker.cm_createtime = cfs_time_current_sec();
01360         mgi->mgi_marker.cm_canceltime = 0;
01361         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&mgi->mgi_bufs, NULL);
01362         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 1, &mgi->mgi_marker,
01363                             sizeof(mgi->mgi_marker));
01364         lcr = lustre_cfg_rec_new(LCFG_MARKER, &mgi->mgi_bufs);
01365         if (lcr == NULL)
01366                 return -ENOMEM;
01367 
01368         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01369         lustre_cfg_rec_free(lcr);
01370         return rc;
01371 }
01372 
01373 static int record_start_log(const struct lu_env *env, struct mgs_device *mgs,
01374                             struct llog_handle **llh, char *name)
01375 {
01376         static struct obd_uuid   cfg_uuid = { .uuid = "config_uuid" };
01377         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01378         int                      rc = 0;
01379         ENTRY;
01380 
01381         if (*llh)
01382                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
01383 
01384         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01385         if (!ctxt)
01386                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
01387         LASSERT(ctxt->loc_obd == mgs->mgs_obd);
01388 
01389         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, llh, NULL, name);
01390         if (rc)
01391                 GOTO(out_ctxt, rc);
01392         rc = llog_init_handle(env, *llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, &cfg_uuid);
01393         if (rc)
01394                 llog_close(env, *llh);
01395 out_ctxt:
01396         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01397 out:
01398         if (rc) {
01399                 CERROR("%s: can't start log %s: rc = %d\n",
01400                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, name, rc);
01401                 *llh = NULL;
01402         }
01403         RETURN(rc);
01404 }
01405 
01406 static int record_end_log(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle **llh)
01407 {
01408         int rc;
01409 
01410         rc = llog_close(env, *llh);
01411         *llh = NULL;
01412 
01413         return rc;
01414 }
01415 
01416 /******************** config "macros" *********************/
01417 
01418 /* write an lcfg directly into a log (with markers) */
01419 static int mgs_write_log_direct(const struct lu_env *env,
01420                                 struct mgs_device *mgs, struct fs_db *fsdb,
01421                                 char *logname, struct llog_cfg_rec *lcr,
01422                                 char *devname, char *comment)
01423 {
01424         struct llog_handle *llh = NULL;
01425         int rc;
01426 
01427         ENTRY;
01428 
01429         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &llh, logname);
01430         if (rc)
01431                 RETURN(rc);
01432 
01433         /* FIXME These should be a single journal transaction */
01434         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_START, devname, comment);
01435         if (rc)
01436                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01437         rc = llog_write(env, llh, &lcr->lcr_hdr, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01438         if (rc)
01439                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01440         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_END, devname, comment);
01441         if (rc)
01442                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01443 out_end:
01444         record_end_log(env, &llh);
01445         RETURN(rc);
01446 }
01447 
01448 /* write the lcfg in all logs for the given fs */
01449 static int mgs_write_log_direct_all(const struct lu_env *env,
01450                                     struct mgs_device *mgs,
01451                                     struct fs_db *fsdb,
01452                                     struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01453                                     struct llog_cfg_rec *lcr, char *devname,
01454                                     char *comment, int server_only)
01455 {
01456         struct list_head         log_list;
01457         struct mgs_direntry     *dirent, *n;
01458         char                    *fsname = mti->mti_fsname;
01459         int                      rc = 0, len = strlen(fsname);
01460 
01461         ENTRY;
01462         /* Find all the logs in the CONFIGS directory */
01463         rc = class_dentry_readdir(env, mgs, &log_list);
01464         if (rc)
01465                 RETURN(rc);
01466 
01467         /* Could use fsdb index maps instead of directory listing */
01468         list_for_each_entry_safe(dirent, n, &log_list, mde_list) {
01469                 list_del_init(&dirent->mde_list);
01470                 /* don't write to sptlrpc rule log */
01471                 if (strstr(dirent->mde_name, "-sptlrpc") != NULL)
01472                         goto next;
01473 
01474                 /* caller wants write server logs only */
01475                 if (server_only && strstr(dirent->mde_name, "-client") != NULL)
01476                         goto next;
01477 
01478                 if (strlen(dirent->mde_name) <= len ||
01479                     strncmp(fsname, dirent->mde_name, len) != 0 ||
01480                     dirent->mde_name[len] != '-')
01481                         goto next;
01482 
01483                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Changing log %s\n", dirent->mde_name);
01484                 /* Erase any old settings of this same parameter */
01485                 rc = mgs_modify(env, mgs, fsdb, mti, dirent->mde_name,
01486                                 devname, comment, CM_SKIP);
01487                 if (rc < 0)
01488                         CERROR("%s: Can't modify llog %s: rc = %d\n",
01489                                mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, dirent->mde_name, rc);
01490                 if (lcr == NULL)
01491                         goto next;
01492                 /* Write the new one */
01493                 rc = mgs_write_log_direct(env, mgs, fsdb, dirent->mde_name,
01494                                           lcr, devname, comment);
01495                 if (rc != 0)
01496                         CERROR("%s: writing log %s: rc = %d\n",
01497                                mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, dirent->mde_name, rc);
01498 next:
01499                 mgs_direntry_free(dirent);
01500         }
01501 
01502         RETURN(rc);
01503 }
01504 
01505 static int mgs_write_log_osp_to_mdt(const struct lu_env *env,
01506                                     struct mgs_device *mgs,
01507                                     struct fs_db *fsdb,
01508                                     struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01509                                     int index, char *logname);
01510 static int mgs_write_log_osc_to_lov(const struct lu_env *env,
01511                                     struct mgs_device *mgs,
01512                                     struct fs_db *fsdb,
01513                                     struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01514                                     char *logname, char *suffix, char *lovname,
01515                                     enum lustre_sec_part sec_part, int flags);
01516 static int name_create_mdt_and_lov(char **logname, char **lovname,
01517                                    struct fs_db *fsdb, int i);
01518 
01519 static int add_param(char *params, char *key, char *val)
01520 {
01521         char *start = params + strlen(params);
01522         char *end = params + sizeof(((struct mgs_target_info *)0)->mti_params);
01523         int keylen = 0;
01524 
01525         if (key != NULL)
01526                 keylen = strlen(key);
01527         if (start + 1 + keylen + strlen(val) >= end) {
01528                 CERROR("params are too long: %s %s%s\n",
01529                        params, key != NULL ? key : "", val);
01530                 return -EINVAL;
01531         }
01532 
01533         sprintf(start, " %s%s", key != NULL ? key : "", val);
01534         return 0;
01535 }
01536 
01541 static int mgs_steal_client_llog_handler(const struct lu_env *env,
01542                                          struct llog_handle *llh,
01543                                          struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01544 {
01545         struct mgs_device *mgs;
01546         struct obd_device *obd;
01547         struct mgs_target_info *mti, *tmti;
01548         struct fs_db *fsdb;
01549         int cfg_len = rec->lrh_len;
01550         char *cfg_buf = (char*) (rec + 1);
01551         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
01552         int rc = 0;
01553         struct llog_handle *mdt_llh = NULL;
01554         static int got_an_osc_or_mdc = 0;
01555         /* 0: not found any osc/mdc;
01556            1: found osc;
01557            2: found mdc;
01558         */
01559         static int last_step = -1;
01560         int cplen = 0;
01561 
01562         ENTRY;
01563 
01564         mti = ((struct temp_comp*)data)->comp_mti;
01565         tmti = ((struct temp_comp*)data)->comp_tmti;
01566         fsdb = ((struct temp_comp*)data)->comp_fsdb;
01567         obd = ((struct temp_comp *)data)->comp_obd;
01568         mgs = lu2mgs_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01569         LASSERT(mgs);
01570 
01571         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
01572                 CERROR("unhandled lrh_type: %#x\n", rec->lrh_type);
01573                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01574         }
01575 
01576         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(cfg_buf, cfg_len);
01577         if (rc) {
01578                 CERROR("Insane cfg\n");
01579                 RETURN(rc);
01580         }
01581 
01582         lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)cfg_buf;
01583 
01584         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_MARKER) {
01585                 struct cfg_marker *marker;
01586                 marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
01587                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add osc", 7) &&
01588                     (marker->cm_flags & CM_START) &&
01589                      !(marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP)) {
01590                         got_an_osc_or_mdc = 1;
01591                         cplen = strlcpy(tmti->mti_svname, marker->cm_tgtname,
01592                                         sizeof(tmti->mti_svname));
01593                         if (cplen >= sizeof(tmti->mti_svname))
01594                                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
01595                         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &mdt_llh,
01596                                               mti->mti_svname);
01597                         if (rc)
01598                                 RETURN(rc);
01599                         rc = record_marker(env, mdt_llh, fsdb, CM_START,
01600                                            mti->mti_svname, "add osc(copied)");
01601                         record_end_log(env, &mdt_llh);
01602                         last_step = marker->cm_step;
01603                         RETURN(rc);
01604                 }
01605                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add osc", 7) &&
01606                     (marker->cm_flags & CM_END) &&
01607                      !(marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP)) {
01608                         LASSERT(last_step == marker->cm_step);
01609                         last_step = -1;
01610                         got_an_osc_or_mdc = 0;
01611                         memset(tmti, 0, sizeof(*tmti));
01612                         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &mdt_llh,
01613                                               mti->mti_svname);
01614                         if (rc)
01615                                 RETURN(rc);
01616                         rc = record_marker(env, mdt_llh, fsdb, CM_END,
01617                                            mti->mti_svname, "add osc(copied)");
01618                         record_end_log(env, &mdt_llh);
01619                         RETURN(rc);
01620                 }
01621                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add mdc", 7) &&
01622                     (marker->cm_flags & CM_START) &&
01623                      !(marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP)) {
01624                         got_an_osc_or_mdc = 2;
01625                         last_step = marker->cm_step;
01626                         memcpy(tmti->mti_svname, marker->cm_tgtname,
01627                                strlen(marker->cm_tgtname));
01628 
01629                         RETURN(rc);
01630                 }
01631                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add mdc", 7) &&
01632                     (marker->cm_flags & CM_END) &&
01633                      !(marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP)) {
01634                         LASSERT(last_step == marker->cm_step);
01635                         last_step = -1;
01636                         got_an_osc_or_mdc = 0;
01637                         memset(tmti, 0, sizeof(*tmti));
01638                         RETURN(rc);
01639                 }
01640         }
01641 
01642         if (got_an_osc_or_mdc == 0 || last_step < 0)
01643                 RETURN(rc);
01644 
01645         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ADD_UUID) {
01646                 __u64 nodenid = lcfg->lcfg_nid;
01647 
01648                 if (strlen(tmti->mti_uuid) == 0) {
01649                         /* target uuid not set, this config record is before
01650                          * LCFG_SETUP, this nid is one of target node nid.
01651                          */
01652                         tmti->mti_nids[tmti->mti_nid_count] = nodenid;
01653                         tmti->mti_nid_count++;
01654                 } else {
01655                         char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
01656 
01657                         /* failover node nid */
01658                         libcfs_nid2str_r(nodenid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
01659                         rc = add_param(tmti->mti_params, PARAM_FAILNODE,
01660                                         nidstr);
01661                 }
01662 
01663                 RETURN(rc);
01664         }
01665 
01666         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_SETUP) {
01667                 char *target;
01668 
01669                 target = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
01670                 memcpy(tmti->mti_uuid, target, strlen(target));
01671                 RETURN(rc);
01672         }
01673 
01674         /* ignore client side sptlrpc_conf_log */
01675         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF)
01676                 RETURN(rc);
01677 
01678         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_ADD_MDC) {
01679                 int index;
01680 
01681                 if (sscanf(lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 2), "%d", &index) != 1)
01682                         RETURN (-EINVAL);
01683 
01684                 memcpy(tmti->mti_fsname, mti->mti_fsname,
01685                        strlen(mti->mti_fsname));
01686                 tmti->mti_stripe_index = index;
01687 
01688                 rc = mgs_write_log_osp_to_mdt(env, mgs, fsdb, tmti,
01689                                               mti->mti_stripe_index,
01690                                               mti->mti_svname);
01691                 memset(tmti, 0, sizeof(*tmti));
01692                 RETURN(rc);
01693         }
01694 
01695         if (lcfg->lcfg_command == LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD) {
01696                 int index;
01697                 char mdt_index[9];
01698                 char *logname, *lovname;
01699 
01700                 rc = name_create_mdt_and_lov(&logname, &lovname, fsdb,
01701                                              mti->mti_stripe_index);
01702                 if (rc)
01703                         RETURN(rc);
01704                 sprintf(mdt_index, "-MDT%04x", mti->mti_stripe_index);
01705 
01706                 if (sscanf(lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 2), "%d", &index) != 1) {
01707                         name_destroy(&logname);
01708                         name_destroy(&lovname);
01709                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01710                 }
01711 
01712                 tmti->mti_stripe_index = index;
01713                 rc = mgs_write_log_osc_to_lov(env, mgs, fsdb, tmti, logname,
01714                                          mdt_index, lovname,
01715                                          LUSTRE_SP_MDT, 0);
01716                 name_destroy(&logname);
01717                 name_destroy(&lovname);
01718                 RETURN(rc);
01719         }
01720         RETURN(rc);
01721 }
01722 
01723 /* fsdb->fsdb_mutex is already held  in mgs_write_log_target*/
01724 /* stealed from mgs_get_fsdb_from_llog*/
01725 static int mgs_steal_llog_for_mdt_from_client(const struct lu_env *env,
01726                                               struct mgs_device *mgs,
01727                                               char *client_name,
01728                                               struct temp_comp* comp)
01729 {
01730         struct llog_handle *loghandle;
01731         struct mgs_target_info *tmti;
01732         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
01733         int rc;
01734 
01735         ENTRY;
01736 
01737         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01738         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
01739 
01740         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(tmti);
01741         if (tmti == NULL)
01742                 GOTO(out_ctxt, rc = -ENOMEM);
01743 
01744         comp->comp_tmti = tmti;
01745         comp->comp_obd = mgs->mgs_obd;
01746 
01747         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &loghandle, NULL, client_name,
01748                        LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01749         if (rc < 0) {
01750                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01751                         rc = 0;
01752                 GOTO(out_pop, rc);
01753         }
01754 
01755         rc = llog_init_handle(env, loghandle, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01756         if (rc)
01757                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01758 
01759         rc = llog_process_or_fork(env, loghandle, mgs_steal_client_llog_handler,
01760                                   (void *)comp, NULL, false);
01761         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "steal llog re = %d\n", rc);
01762 out_close:
01763         llog_close(env, loghandle);
01764 out_pop:
01765         OBD_FREE_PTR(tmti);
01766 out_ctxt:
01767         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01768         RETURN(rc);
01769 }
01770 
01771 /* lmv is the second thing for client logs */
01772 /* copied from mgs_write_log_lov. Please refer to that.  */
01773 static int mgs_write_log_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
01774                              struct mgs_device *mgs,
01775                              struct fs_db *fsdb,
01776                              struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01777                              char *logname, char *lmvname)
01778 {
01779         struct llog_handle *llh = NULL;
01780         struct lmv_desc *lmvdesc;
01781         char *uuid;
01782         int rc = 0;
01783         ENTRY;
01784 
01785         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Writing lmv(%s) log for %s\n", lmvname,logname);
01786 
01787         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lmvdesc);
01788         if (lmvdesc == NULL)
01789                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01790         lmvdesc->ld_active_tgt_count = 0;
01791         lmvdesc->ld_tgt_count = 0;
01792         sprintf((char*)lmvdesc->ld_uuid.uuid, "%s_UUID", lmvname);
01793         uuid = (char *)lmvdesc->ld_uuid.uuid;
01794 
01795         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &llh, logname);
01796         if (rc)
01797                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01798         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_START, lmvname, "lmv setup");
01799         if (rc)
01800                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01801         rc = record_attach(env, llh, lmvname, "lmv", uuid);
01802         if (rc)
01803                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01804         rc = record_lmv_setup(env, llh, lmvname, lmvdesc);
01805         if (rc)
01806                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01807         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_END, lmvname, "lmv setup");
01808         if (rc)
01809                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01810 out_end:
01811         record_end_log(env, &llh);
01812 out_free:
01813         OBD_FREE_PTR(lmvdesc);
01814         RETURN(rc);
01815 }
01816 
01817 /* lov is the first thing in the mdt and client logs */
01818 static int mgs_write_log_lov(const struct lu_env *env, struct mgs_device *mgs,
01819                              struct fs_db *fsdb, struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01820                              char *logname, char *lovname)
01821 {
01822         struct llog_handle *llh = NULL;
01823         struct lov_desc *lovdesc;
01824         char *uuid;
01825         int rc = 0;
01826         ENTRY;
01827 
01828         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Writing lov(%s) log for %s\n", lovname, logname);
01829 
01830         /*
01831         #01 L attach   0:lov_mdsA  1:lov  2:71ccb_lov_mdsA_19f961a9e1
01832         #02 L lov_setup 0:lov_mdsA 1:(struct lov_desc)
01833               uuid=lov1_UUID, stripe count=1, size=1048576, offset=0, pattern=0
01834         */
01835 
01836         /* FIXME just make lov_setup accept empty desc (put uuid in buf 2) */
01837         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lovdesc);
01838         if (lovdesc == NULL)
01839                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01840         lovdesc->ld_magic = LOV_DESC_MAGIC;
01841         lovdesc->ld_tgt_count = 0;
01842         /* Defaults.  Can be changed later by lcfg config_param */
01843         lovdesc->ld_default_stripe_count = 1;
01844         lovdesc->ld_pattern = LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
01845         lovdesc->ld_default_stripe_size = LOV_DESC_STRIPE_SIZE_DEFAULT;
01846         lovdesc->ld_default_stripe_offset = -1;
01847         lovdesc->ld_qos_maxage = LOV_DESC_QOS_MAXAGE_DEFAULT;
01848         sprintf((char*)lovdesc->ld_uuid.uuid, "%s_UUID", lovname);
01849         /* can these be the same? */
01850         uuid = (char *)lovdesc->ld_uuid.uuid;
01851 
01852         /* This should always be the first entry in a log.
01853         rc = mgs_clear_log(obd, logname); */
01854         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &llh, logname);
01855         if (rc)
01856                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01857         /* FIXME these should be a single journal transaction */
01858         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_START, lovname, "lov setup");
01859         if (rc)
01860                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01861         rc = record_attach(env, llh, lovname, "lov", uuid);
01862         if (rc)
01863                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01864         rc = record_lov_setup(env, llh, lovname, lovdesc);
01865         if (rc)
01866                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01867         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_END, lovname, "lov setup");
01868         if (rc)
01869                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01870         EXIT;
01871 out_end:
01872         record_end_log(env, &llh);
01873 out_free:
01874         OBD_FREE_PTR(lovdesc);
01875         return rc;
01876 }
01877 
01878 /* add failnids to open log */
01879 static int mgs_write_log_failnids(const struct lu_env *env,
01880                                   struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01881                                   struct llog_handle *llh,
01882                                   char *cliname)
01883 {
01884         char *failnodeuuid = NULL;
01885         char *ptr = mti->mti_params;
01886         lnet_nid_t nid;
01887         int rc = 0;
01888 
01889         /*
01890         #03 L add_uuid  nid=uml1@tcp(0x20000c0a80201) nal=90 0:  1:uml1_UUID
01891         #04 L add_uuid  nid=1@elan(0x1000000000001)   nal=90 0:  1:uml1_UUID
01892         #05 L setup    0:OSC_uml1_ost1_mdsA  1:ost1_UUID  2:uml1_UUID
01893         #06 L add_uuid  nid=uml2@tcp(0x20000c0a80202) nal=90 0:  1:uml2_UUID
01894         #0x L add_uuid  nid=2@elan(0x1000000000002)   nal=90 0:  1:uml2_UUID
01895         #07 L add_conn 0:OSC_uml1_ost1_mdsA  1:uml2_UUID
01896         */
01897 
01898         /*
01899          * Pull failnid info out of params string, which may contain something
01900          * like "<nid1>,<nid2>:<nid3>,<nid4>".  class_parse_nid() does not
01901          * complain about abnormal inputs like ",:<nid1>", "<nid1>:,<nid2>",
01902          * etc.  However, convert_hostnames() should have caught those.
01903          */
01904         while (class_find_param(ptr, PARAM_FAILNODE, &ptr) == 0) {
01905                 while (class_parse_nid(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
01906                         char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
01907 
01908                         if (failnodeuuid == NULL) {
01909                                 /* We don't know the failover node name,
01910                                  * so just use the first nid as the uuid */
01911                                 libcfs_nid2str_r(nid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
01912                                 rc = name_create(&failnodeuuid, nidstr, "");
01913                                 if (rc != 0)
01914                                         return rc;
01915                         }
01916                         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "add nid %s for failover uuid %s, "
01917                                 "client %s\n",
01918                                 libcfs_nid2str_r(nid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr)),
01919                                 failnodeuuid, cliname);
01920                         rc = record_add_uuid(env, llh, nid, failnodeuuid);
01921                         /*
01922                          * If *ptr is ':', we have added all NIDs for
01923                          * failnodeuuid.
01924                          */
01925                         if (*ptr == ':') {
01926                                 rc = record_add_conn(env, llh, cliname,
01927                                                      failnodeuuid);
01928                                 name_destroy(&failnodeuuid);
01929                                 failnodeuuid = NULL;
01930                         }
01931                 }
01932                 if (failnodeuuid) {
01933                         rc = record_add_conn(env, llh, cliname, failnodeuuid);
01934                         name_destroy(&failnodeuuid);
01935                         failnodeuuid = NULL;
01936                 }
01937         }
01938 
01939         return rc;
01940 }
01941 
01942 static int mgs_write_log_mdc_to_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
01943                                     struct mgs_device *mgs,
01944                                     struct fs_db *fsdb,
01945                                     struct mgs_target_info *mti,
01946                                     char *logname, char *lmvname)
01947 {
01948         struct llog_handle *llh = NULL;
01949         char *mdcname = NULL;
01950         char *nodeuuid = NULL;
01951         char *mdcuuid = NULL;
01952         char *lmvuuid = NULL;
01953         char index[6];
01954         char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
01955         int i, rc;
01956         ENTRY;
01957 
01958         if (mgs_log_is_empty(env, mgs, logname)) {
01959                 CERROR("log is empty! Logical error\n");
01960                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01961         }
01962 
01963         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "adding mdc for %s to log %s:lmv(%s)\n",
01964                mti->mti_svname, logname, lmvname);
01965 
01966         libcfs_nid2str_r(mti->mti_nids[0], nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
01967         rc = name_create(&nodeuuid, nidstr, "");
01968         if (rc)
01969                 RETURN(rc);
01970         rc = name_create(&mdcname, mti->mti_svname, "-mdc");
01971         if (rc)
01972                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01973         rc = name_create(&mdcuuid, mdcname, "_UUID");
01974         if (rc)
01975                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01976         rc = name_create(&lmvuuid, lmvname, "_UUID");
01977         if (rc)
01978                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01979 
01980         rc = record_start_log(env, mgs, &llh, logname);
01981         if (rc)
01982                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
01983         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_START, mti->mti_svname,
01984                            "add mdc");
01985         if (rc)
01986                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
01987         for (i = 0; i < mti->mti_nid_count; i++) {
01988                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "add nid %s for mdt\n",
01989                         libcfs_nid2str_r(mti->mti_nids[i],
01990                                          nidstr, sizeof(nidstr)));
01991 
01992                 rc = record_add_uuid(env, llh, mti->mti_nids[i], nodeuuid);
01993                 if (rc)
01994                         GOTO(out_end, rc);
01995         }
01996 
01997         rc = record_attach(env, llh, mdcname, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME, lmvuuid);
01998         if (rc)
01999                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
02000         rc = record_setup(env, llh, mdcname, mti->mti_uuid, nodeuuid,
02001                           NULL, NULL);
02002         if (rc)
02003                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
02004         rc = mgs_write_log_failnids(env, mti, llh, mdcname);
02005         if (rc)
02006                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
02007         snprintf(index, sizeof(index), "%d", mti->mti_stripe_index);
02008         rc = record_mdc_add(env, llh, lmvname, mdcuuid, mti->mti_uuid,
02009                             index, "1");
02010         if (rc)
02011                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
02012         rc = record_marker(env, llh, fsdb, CM_END, mti->mti_svname,
02013                            "add mdc");
02014         if (rc)
02015                 GOTO(out_end, rc);
02016 out_end:
02017         record_end_log(env, &llh);
02018 out_free:
02019         name_destroy(&lmvuuid);
02020         name_destroy(&mdcuuid);
02021         name_destroy(&mdcname);
02022         name_destroy(&nodeuuid);
02023         RETURN(rc);
02024 }
02025 
02026 static inline int name_create_lov(char **lovname, char *mdtname,
02027                                   struct fs_db *fsdb, int index)
02028 {
02029         /* COMPAT_180 */
02030         if (index == 0 && test_bit(FSDB_OSCNAME18, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
02031                 return name_create(lovname, fsdb->fsdb_name, "-mdtlov");
02032         else
02033                 return name_create(lovname, mdtname, "-mdtlov");
02034 }
02035 
02036 static int name_create_mdt_and_lov(char **logname, char **lovname,
02037                                    struct fs_db *fsdb, int i)
02038 {
02039         int rc;
02040 
02041         rc = name_create_mdt(logname, fsdb->fsdb_name, i);
02042         if (rc)
02043                 return rc;
02044         /* COMPAT_180 */
02045         if (i == 0 && test_bit(FSDB_OSCNAME18, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
02046                 rc = name_create(lovname, fsdb->fsdb_name, "-mdtlov");
02047         else
02048                 rc = name_create(lovname, *logname, "-mdtlov");
02049         if (rc) {
02050                 name_destroy(logname);
02051                 *logname = NULL;
02052         }
02053         return rc;
02054 }
02055 
02056 static inline int name_create_mdt_osc(char **oscname, char *ostname,
02057                                       struct fs_db *fsdb, int i)
02058 {
02059         char suffix[16];
02060 
02061         if (i == 0 && test_bit(FSDB_OSCNAME18, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
02062                 sprintf(suffix, "-osc");
02063         else
02064                 sprintf(suffix, "-osc-MDT%04x", i);
02065         return name_create(oscname, ostname, suffix);
02066 }
02067 
02068 /* add new mdc to already existent MDS */
02069 static int mgs_write_log_osp_to_mdt(const struct lu_env *env,
